root.title: Network Sniffing - Linux
root.description: Network sniffing refers to using the network interface on a system to monitor or capture information sent over a wired or wireless connection. An adversary may place a network interface into promiscuous mode to passively access data in transit over the network, or use span ports to capture a larger amount of data.
root.author: Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community

falsepositives.item: Legitimate administrator or user uses network sniffing tool for legitimate reasons.
